source.51797a7e:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly_express as px

fig = px.choropleth(df_country,locations='country_code',color='total score',scope='world',title='Best Country for Startups by Total Score')
fig.show()

source.cb110321:
fig = px.scatter_mapbox(df_city_100,lat='latitude',lon='longitude',hover_name='city',hover_data=['total score'],color='total score',
    size="total score",size_max=50,opacity=0.4,
    center={'lat':50, 'lon':9},
    zoom=1,
    height=800,
    width=1400)
fig.update_layout(mapbox_style='open-street-map')
fig.update_layout(margin={"r": 0, "t": 0, "l": 0, "b": 0})
fig.update_layout(title_text="City Map for Start up by total score")
fig.show()

source.8fcdc8b7:
![Startup-Ecosystem.jpg](attachment:d6cbd7a6-ff96-40e9-bc7b-a4fbcab231d2.jpg)

image from Pittsburgh Health Data Alliance https://healthdataalliance.com/blog/the-startup-ecosystem/
source.da5d73d5:
What country and what city is good for startups ? There are some factors which include 
* 'Quantity' Number of startups, number of coworking spaces,etc....
* 'Quality'  Qualitative results achieved by the ecosystem, etc...
* 'Business Score' A mix of business and economic indicators at the national level, etc...

I tried global and city map which you can find what coutry and city is better for startups.
source.8f5032f4: 5) Top 50 countries which have good cities for startups
source.3d6f4d86: There are large gap in 'Quality Score' between United States and other countries.
